The Sapphic Gaze

About Reviews Submit

The Watermelon Woman is a landmark of the New Queer Cinema of the 1990s, a time of queer formal experimentation with cinematic language.

Lisa, a queer Chinese American woman (Celia Au) plans to finally marry her long-term girlfriend. As she navigates the trans-generational challenges of telling her father (Fenton Li), other secrets test the bounds of family and culture.

Yoon-ju, an art student, bumps into Ji-soo at the junk shop and slowly falls in love with her.
